code:
import turtle

wn = turtle.Screen()
wn.bgcolor('white')

t1 = turtle.Turtle()

t1.goto(100,0)
t1.goto(100,100)
t1.goto(-100,100)
t1.goto(-100,0)

t1.goto(0,0)

guide.img: Draw a rectangle just by using our goto functions, to get a hang of coordinates we can use our goto function to try and draw a shape.
First, move our turtle to 100 pixels at x by giving (100,0)
guide.code:
import turtle

wn = turtle.Screen()
wn.bgcolor('white')

t1 = turtle.Turtle()

t1.goto(100,0)

guide.img: Now move our turtle to 100 pixels at y, therefore moving it top by giving (100,100)
guide.code:
import turtle

wn = turtle.Screen()
wn.bgcolor('white')

t1 = turtle.Turtle()

t1.goto(100,0)
t1.goto(100,100)

guide.img: Now move our turtle to the opposite direction, since we are just moving it along the x-axis, make the x-axis negative by giving (-100,100)
guide.code:
import turtle

wn = turtle.Screen()
wn.bgcolor('white')

t1 = turtle.Turtle()

t1.goto(100,0)
t1.goto(100,100)
t1.goto(-100,100)

guide.img: We have to move our turtle downwards now, so move it along the y-direction making it 0 again
guide.code:
import turtle

wn = turtle.Screen()
wn.bgcolor('white')

t1 = turtle.Turtle()

t1.goto(100,0)
t1.goto(100,100)
t1.goto(-100,100)
t1.goto(-100,0)

guide.img: Let's get back to origin by giving (0,0)
guide.code:
import turtle

wn = turtle.Screen()
wn.bgcolor('white')

t1 = turtle.Turtle()

t1.goto(100,0)
t1.goto(100,100)
t1.goto(-100,100)
t1.goto(-100,0)

t1.goto(0,0)
